document.docAuthor: Cruz Da Silva, Estevam L. & Carico, James E.
document.docTitle: Thaumasia onca Cruz Da Silva & Carico 2012, new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type.
Male holotype from Gruta Onça , Dianópolis , Tocantins , Brazil [ 11°37’S , 46°49’W ],
04-12.III.2008
, Pellegatti-Franco ( IBSP 134158 ). Paratype : female from Maravilha , Porto Velho , Rondônia , Brazil [ 08°45’S , 63°54’W ],
IV.1996
, Equipe IBSP / SMNK ( IBSP 15627 )
.
Etymology. The specific name is a noun and refers to the type locality.

Diagnosis. The males of
T. onca
sp. nov.
resemble those of
T. xingu
sp. nov.
( Fig. 140 ) in the bifurcated apex of the median apophysis (MA) ( Figs 111, 112 ), but can be distinguished by the presence of a median curvature on the median apophysis ( Fig. 112 ) and by the lamellar base and slender tip of the ental branch of RTA ( Fig. 114 ). The females resemble those of
T. hirsutochela
sp. nov.
( Fig. 104 ) in the median projection of the middle field of epigynum ( Fig. 107 ), but can be distinguished by the deep lateral excavation on the middle field ( Fig. 107 ) and by the rounded head of spermathecae ( Fig. 109 ).

Female ( Paratype , Porto Velho , Rondônia , Brazil , IBSP 15627 ). Total length 6.47. Carapace 2.57 long, 2.32 wide, as in male. Clypeus yellow, 0.22 high. Anterior eye row straight, 0.66 wide; posterior recurved, 1.18 wide. Eye diameters, interdistances, and median ocular quadrangle: AME 0.12, ALE 0.10, PME 0.20, PLE 0.20; AME- AME 0.12, AME-ALE 0.06, PME-PME 0.23, PME-PLE 0.24, OQA 0.36, OQP 0.60, OQH 0.46. Chelicerae light brown, bristly. Sternum whitish, bristly; 1.24 long, 1.32 wide. Labium as in male, 0.24 long, 0.28 wide. Legs yellow, unmarked; relative length: IV-I-II-III, I—femur 4.23/ patella-tibia 5.97/ metatarsus 4.15/ tarsus 1.57/ total 15.92; II—4.15/ 5.39/ 3.73/ 1.55/ 14.82; III—2.98/ 3.23/ 2.32/ 1.16/ 9.69; IV—4.31/ 5.14/ 4.89/ 1.90/ 16.24. Ventral pairs of macrosetae on tibiae: I-4; II-3 ; III-3; IV-3. Superior tarsal claw with nine teeth and inferior with one tooth ( Fig. 110 ). Abdomen 3.48 long, colouration as in male. Epigynum with a projected middle field ( Fig. 107 ) and conspicuous lateral hoods ( Fig. 107 ). Stalk of spermathecae short ( Fig. 108 ), copulatory ducts ( CD1 , CD2 ) triangular ( Fig. 108 ) and head of spermathecae prominent and rounded ( Fig. 109 )
.

Distribution. Colombia , Ecuador , Guyana , Peru and Brazil ( Fig. 1 ).
